page.title: 16Fen Ditton Hall Barn
page.content: Mrs. Howell moved to Fen Ditton Hall with her late husband 11 years ago. The old barn in the Hall grounds was falling down but because it was a listed building it could not be demolished. Mrs. Howell therefore had it restored. The work done, a friend was permitted to store his grand piano there provided others could have access to it.This led to a recital. Later a local musician gave a concert in the barn with some singers who were students of his. This led on to other ideas, including exhibitions and plays. Shakespeare's "The Taming of the Shrew." has been performed in the barn, and there has been an exhibition of work by local school children, but the most successful venture was the staging of the opera,"The Turn of the Screw."
